definition: to print/to publish/publication/periodical/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend

sentences.english: This word had found its way into newspapers and magazines.
sentences.chinese: 這個詞已廣泛用於報刊雜誌。

sentences.english: He then closed, moved to Sydney, and the whereabouts of the newsstand workers in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 他隨後結束營業，遷至悉尼，並在林暋的報刊亭幫工。

sentences.english: The post also included contact information with the assistant to the publisher.
sentences.chinese: 文章中還公佈了報刊發行助理的聯繫方式。

sentences.english: Furthermore I style of writing is good, have published in newspapers and periodicals 6 article.
sentences.chinese: 再者，我的文筆較好，曾在報刊上發表過6篇文章。

sentences.english: Maxwell Alves contributes articles to magazines and newspapers regularly.
sentences.chinese: 馬兆融博士律師行定期在雜誌和報刊上發表文章。

sentences.english: I also wrote articales for newspapers and journals , to make some extra money.
sentences.chinese: 並且爲報刊撰稿賺取外快。

sentences.english: Part six have mainly investigated the periodical-editing activity of Xie Liuyi.
sentences.chinese: 第六部分主要考察了謝六逸的報刊編輯活動。

sentences.english: The joint communiqué between the two countries was notified in the newspapers and over the radio.
sentences.chinese: 兩國發表的聯合公報已在各大報刊並以廣播形式公佈。

sentences.english: Chinese modern press industry started from the press hold by the foreigners in China.
sentences.chinese: 中國近代報刊業，肇始於外國人在華創辦的報刊。

sentences.english: Chinese modern press industry started from the press hold by the foreigners in China.
sentences.chinese: 中國近代報刊業，肇始於外國人在華創辦的報刊。

sentences.english: In the American press, variety is everything.
sentences.chinese: 在美國報刊業，多樣化是最爲重要的事情。

sentences.english: The great learned journals are in their early phase.
sentences.chinese: 重要的報刊也初現雛形。

sentences.english: To read and understand English newspapers, journals, magazines and books.
sentences.chinese: 能讀懂一樣尋常的報刊文章書籍。

sentences.english: Postal enterprises shall strengthen distribution work of newspapers and periodicals.
sentences.chinese: 郵政企業應當加強報刊發行工作。

sentences.english: Her efforts have been widely published in newspapers and magazines.
sentences.chinese: 她的努力在報刊和雜誌上得到廣泛宣傳。

sentences.english: The service has been credited (or blamed, depending on your point of view) with taking the classified ad market away from established newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 這項服務被認爲瓜分了報刊的分類廣告業務。

definition: domestic and international/at home and abroad
to include (in a collection)/to put together (stories, poems etc)/to record/to employ/to recruit
